entry.title: DOUGLAS ELECTRIC COOPERATIVE HAS POWER RESTORED
entry.summary: January 10, 2024 11:00 a.m. Crews with the Douglas Electric Cooperative restored power to nearly 1,100 meters by mid-morning Wednesday. The outage, which lasted for several hours, mainly impacted customers in the Scottsburg and Elkton areas when a transmission line failed. entry.title: Compliance Monitoring Program Committee meets Jan. 18
entry.summary:
SALEM, Ore. — The Compliance Monitoring Program Committee will hold a virtual meeting Thursday, Jan. 18, from 9 to 11 a.m. To join virtually, please use the Zoom video conference information found on the agenda. The committee’s agenda includes:
CMP Long term outlook Follow-up items from previous meeting Long term study – Riparian rule selection discussion
The meeting is open to the public to attend online via Zoom. Requests for an interpreter for the hearing impaired or other accommodations for persons with disabilities should be made at least 48 hours before the meeting by emailing adam.coble@odf.oregon.gov. The CMP Committee assists efforts to monitor compliance with Forest Practices Rules. The committee advises ODF regarding monitoring projects and procedures. View more information on the CMPC webpage.

entry.title: Committee for Family Forestlands meets Jan. 11
entry.summary:
SALEM, Ore. — The Committee for Family Forestlands will meet virtually on Thursday, Jan. 11 from 9 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. To join virtually, please use the Zoom video conference information found on the agenda. The committee’s agenda includes:
Forest Resources Division update Small Forestland Owner Office update Private Forest Accord update Board of Forestry update Adaptive Management Program Committee review Agenda topics and meeting schedule discussion
The meeting is open to the public to attend online via Zoom. Public comments will be accepted near the start of the meeting. Requests for an interpreter for the hearing impaired or other accommodations for persons with disabilities should be made at least 24 hours before the meeting by emailing committee.of.family.forestlands@odf.oregon.gov. The 13-member committee researches policies that affect family forests, natural resources and forestry benefits. Based on its findings, the committee recommends actions to the Oregon Board of Forestry and the State Forester. View more information on the CFF webpage.
